availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Lydia G. Gray. Father of Carolina Gray, William J. Gray, Sandford D. Gray, Sarah E. Gray, Lucretia Gray, Nancy Gray, John Gray, Milly Gray, Susan Gray, Charlie Gray, and America Gray. Farmer in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Long Pond in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 368A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Long Pond, p. 8.
"Nathan Oliver Gray (1815-1867)," Find A Grave, Memorial #158142043, accessed September 14, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/158142043.
